intro: Hesperis exigua, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue to white, with four petals and prominent yellow veins. Hesperis exigua is often found in grasslands, woodland edges, and rocky soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
